publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3496 Shiona Baird: Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group—That the Parliament congratulates the Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group on its 50 years of service to patients in and around Dundee, firstly as TOC H, then Radio Tayside, Hospital Radio Tayside, Radio Liff and most recently BRIDGEfm; acknowledges the important therapeutic role that hospital radio plays in aiding the recovery of patients, as well as its ability to bring the community to patients who might otherwise feel isolated from everyday life; commends BRIDGEfm on the quality and diversity of the programmes it broadcasts to hospitals in Tayside, and commends the invaluable work undertaken by hospital radio volunteers past and present, whose commitment of time, energy and enthusiasm has ensured the success of this popular local broadcasting service.Supported by: Mrs Nanette Milne*, Chris Ballance*, Murdo Fraser*, Shona Robison*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Ms Sandra White*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3496 Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group (lodged on 1 November 2005) Mr David Davidson*, Frances Curran*
S2M-3496 Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group (lodged on 1 November 2005) Robin Harper*

S2M-3496 Shiona Baird: Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group—That the Parliament congratulates the Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group on its 50 years of service to patients in and around Dundee, firstly as TOC H, then Radio Tayside, Hospital Radio Tayside, Radio Liff and most recently BRIDGEfm; acknowledges the important therapeutic role that hospital radio plays in aiding the recovery of patients, as well as its ability to bring the community to patients who might otherwise feel isolated from everyday life; commends BRIDGEfm on the quality and diversity of the programmes it broadcasts to hospitals in Tayside, and commends the invaluable work undertaken by hospital radio volunteers past and present, whose commitment of time, energy and enthusiasm has ensured the success of this popular local broadcasting service.Supported by: Mrs Nanette Milne, Chris Ballance, Murdo Fraser, Shona Robison, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Ms Sandra White, Eleanor Scott, Mr David Davidson, Frances Curran, Robin Harper
S2M-3496 Tayside Hospital Broadcasting Group (lodged on 1 November 2005) Elaine Smith*
